questions.text: Which statement best reflects Boulding's view on the relationship between theories and facts?
options: (a) Facts are more important than theories.
(b) Theories are more important than facts.
(c) Theories and facts are equally important and interdependent.
(d) Facts are meaningless without theories, and theories may be unproductive without facts.

questions.text: Which of the following is the definition of a variable in a theory?
options: (a) A fixed value in an equation
(b) A magnitude that can take on different possible values
(c) A constant used for calculations
(d) An element that remains unchanged

questions.text: In the example of soft drink sales in Ile-Ife, what does the variable "demand" refer to?
options: (a) The price of soft drinks
(b) The number of consumers
(c) The quantity of crates of soft drinks purchased at a specific time
(d) The availability of soft drinks in stores

questions.text: Which of the following statements best describes the difference between endogenous and exogenous variables?
options: Exogenous variables influence endogenous variables, but endogenous variables are determined within the theory.
Endogenous variables influence exogenous variables, but exogenous variables are determined within the theory.
Both endogenous and exogenous variables are determined within the theory.
Both endogenous and exogenous variables are determined by forces outside the theory.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the assumed motivations of individuals and firms in economic decision-making?
options: Individuals are motivated by seeking social approval, while firms are motivated by employee satisfaction.
Individuals are motivated by following government regulations, while firms are motivated by environmental sustainability.
Individuals are motivated by altruism, while firms are motivated by social responsibility.
Individuals are motivated by pursuing self-interest, while firms are motivated by profit maximization.
